dta.Node¶

class dta.Node(id, x, y, geometryType, label=None, level=None)¶

Bases: object

Base class that represents a node in a network.

Note

lmz has read over this, so todos are marked.

__init__(id, x, y, geometryType, label=None, level=None)¶

Constructor.

  • id is a unique identifier (unique within the containing network), an integer
  • x and y are coordinates in the units specified by Node.COORDINATE_UNITS
  • geometryType is one of Node.GEOMETRY_TYPE_INTERSECTION, Node.GEOMETRY_TYPE_JUNCTION, or Node.GEOMETRY_TYPE_VIRTUAL
  • label is a string, for readability. If None passed, will use default.
  • level is for vertical alignment. More details TBD. If None passed, will use default.

Methods

COORDINATE_UNITS¶

Static variable represengint the units of the x,y (and so therefore Euclidean length) Should be meters or feet

GEOMETRY_TYPE_CENTROID¶

Centroid geometry type

GEOMETRY_TYPE_INTERSECTION¶

RoadNode geometry type

GEOMETRY_TYPE_JUNCTION¶

RoadNode geometry type

GEOMETRY_TYPE_VIRTUAL¶

VirtualNode geometry type

getCardinality()¶

Return a pair of numbers representing the number of incoming and outgoing links respectively.

getId()¶

Returns the integer id for this node.

getIncomingLinkForId(linkId)¶

Returns an incoming link if one has an ID matching linkId. It no incoming links qualify, raises a DtaError.

getIncomingLinkForNodeId(nodeId)¶

Returns an incoming link if one starts from nodeId. It no incoming links qualify, raises a DtaError.

getMovement(startNodeId, endNodeId)¶

Return the Movement from startNodeId to endNodeId that goes through this node.

getName()¶

Return the name of the intersection as a string consisting of the upper-cased labels of the incoming links in sorted order, separated by AND. (e.g. VAN NESS AVE AND MARKET ST)

getNumAdjacentLinks()¶

Returns the number of links adjacent to this node (either incoming or outgoing).

getNumAdjacentNodes()¶

Return the number of nodes that are connected to this node.

getNumAdjacentRoadLinks()¶

Returns the number of RoadLink instances adjacent to this node (either incoming or outgoing).

getNumAdjacentRoadNodes()¶

Return the number of RoadNode instances that share a link with this node.

getNumIncomingLinks()¶

Returns the number of incoming links.

getNumMovements()¶

Return the number of Movement instances associated with this node.

getNumOutgoingLinks()¶

Returns the number of outgoing links.

getStreetNames(incoming=True, outgoing=False)¶

Return the street names (labels) of the relevant links as a sorted upper-case list.

getX()¶

Returns the x-coordinate for this node.

getY()¶

Returns the y-coordinate for this node.

hasConnector()¶

Return True if there is a connector attached to the node.

hasIncomingLinkForId(linkId)¶

Returns True if there is an incoming link with the given linkId.

hasIncomingLinkForNodeId(nodeId)¶

Returns True if there is an incoming link starting from nodeId.

hasMovement(startNodeId, endNodeId)¶

Return True if a Movement exists from the node with startNodeId through this node to the node with endNodeId, and if that movement is not prohibited.

hasOutgoingLinkForId(linkId)¶

Returns True if there is an outgoing link with the given linkId.

hasOutgoingLinkForNodeId(nodeId)¶

Returns True if there is an outgoing link towards a node with the given nodeId.

isIntersection()¶

Return True if this node is an intersection

Todo

And an intersection is what? Technical definition please.

isJunction()¶

Return True if this node is a junction.

Todo

And a junction is what? Technical definition please.

isShapePoint(countRoadNodesOnly=False)¶

Return True if the node is a shape point (e.g. Node 51245 in the following graph).

If countRoadNodesOnly is True the method will count only RoadLinks attached to this Node and will disregard any connectors.

Todo

I think this documentation is insufficient; it’s just an example, it doesn’t define a “shape point.” Further, there are “shapepoints” that are not this, such as in those added via RoadLink.addShapePoint(), so the terminology should be more accurate – what we’re really checking is if this could be a shape point? And we’re not even doing that – this implementation would call a node a shapepoint if there is a one-way loop (consisting of two links) intersecting with a one way street.

iterAdjacentLinks()¶

Return an iterator to all Link instances adjacent (incoming or outgoing) to this node

iterAdjacentNodes()¶

Return an iterator to the adjacent Node instances.

iterAdjacentRoadLinks()¶

Return an iterator to all RoadLink instances adjacent to this node (excluding Connectors)

iterAdjacentRoadNodes()¶

Return an iterator to all RoadNode instances adjacent to this Node

iterDownstreamNodes()¶

Returns an iterator to the end nodes of all outgoing links.

iterIncomingLinks()¶

Returns iterator for the incoming links.

iterLinks()¶

Returns an iterator to all adjacent links.

iterMovements()¶

Return an iterator to all the Movement instances going through the node.

iterOutgoingLinks()¶

Returns iterator for the outgoing links.

iterUpstreamNodes()¶

Returns an iterator to the start nodes of all incoming links.
